message: Have a Happy New Year everyone and please be safe. I'm so grateful and excited to be representing the great people of Louisiana in the United States Senate in 2017. Now, it's time to get to work!

A wonderful yet humbling experience today as I was sworn in as a U.S. Senator.  I was thrilled that my family was able to be with me on this day. Tomorrow, we get to work on behalf of the people of Louisiana. I won't let you down.

Folks, a special session of Congress certified the electoral votes today giving us a new President and a better direction for our country. President Trump and Vice-President Pence are our new leaders, and I couldn't be more excited about the possibilities that we now have before us. The people of this great nation are ready and I am too. Now, it's time to make the voters proud!
NA
NA
Former President Obama leaving Washington, D.C. as a private citizen.

If you want to start a landscaping business, all you should need is a lawnmower—not a lawnmower, a lawyer, a CPA and a compliance officer.   Federal government regulations cost every American family $15,000 a year.  I am co-sponsoring S:56, The RED Tape Act of 2017, to help our small businesses create jobs.

I voted "no" because the federal government has to learn to live within its means, period. Tax dollars represent the sweat and hard work of American families, and we owe it to them to pass a balanced budget. I'm not going to stop until we do just that.
In America, racists have the right to speak freely and nonviolently about their racist views, but I also have the right to freely and nonviolently condemn their views. And I do.

Touring flood recovery efforts in Denham Springs today with HUD Secretary Dr. Ben Carson. Very pleased he accepted our invitation to see for himself how far we have come, but that we still have much left to accomplish.

Yesterday, I had the honor of teaching 8th graders at Southside Junior High in Denham Springs as a substitute teacher. A school devastated by last year's floods, just trying to get back on its feet; in a community still trying to pick up the pieces. Please keep these students and their families in your prayers as they start this school year and continue rebuilding their lives a year later. Geaux Bucs!! Livingston Parish Public Schools City of Denham Springs - Mayor & City CouncilSouthside Junior High School

Politicians need to step back into the classroom, so they can see what our teachers are facing. There’s a disconnect between policymakers and what actually happens in the classroom. My Senate resolution would be a step in the right direction by asking members of Congress to substitute teach in a public school at least once a year.

America was built with the sweat and hard work of small family farmers and small businesses. But, for too long, they've been drowning in red tape and suffering from bad trade deals that threaten their livelihoods. I'll keep fighting to hold China and Mexico accountable for cheating on trade deals and to get Washington bureaucrats off the backs of our farm families.  City of Youngsville Louisiana Youngsville Police Department Mayor Ken Ritter

This morning, I spoke with Vice President Mike Pence to discuss the on-going situation with Hurricane Harvey. I told him that the people of Louisiana are strong and will make it through this thing come hell or high water. Just like we always do. Thank you for standing with us and having our backs, Mr. Vice President!

The people of Texas have always been there for us after a natural disaster, and now, they need us. If you can give, then give. If you can go and serve, then go and serve. If you can't do either of those things, then keep praying for those families. To the people of southeast Texas, Louisiana stands with you and is ready to help and serve.
God bless the Cajun Navy! Cajun Navy 2016 and other groups are on the way.

Please continue to pray for and support our first responders, LA National Guard, law enforcement, utility crews, and Cajun Navy. They are putting their lives on the line to rescue people in Lake Charles, Houston, and across Louisiana. These folks are living out what it truly means to "Love thy neighbor as thyself," and that's what America is all about.

I'm so grateful for the good folks over at Rouses Markets who are donating food to the Cajun Navy 2016. If you are in one of their stores today, please remember to tell them how much you appreciate their generosity and willingness to serve.
NA

Mr. President, the people of Louisiana and Texas are grateful that you stood with us today in the midst of Harvey's devastation. We're resilient folks, and I'm glad you got to see that fighting spirit first-hand. The people of our great states just want to tell you "thank you" for your leadership this week during this disaster. Please like and share if you agree.  #LouisianaStrong #TexasStrong #AmericaStrong. President Donald J. Trump Donald J. Trump

It looks like the Equifax executives were busy cashing out while our personal information was being compromised.   Please spread the word about this data breach, so that folks can determine whether or not their sensitive info. was included. 143 million Americans have been impacted.

Please continue to keep the people of Florida in your thoughts and prayers tonight. There will be a long road of recovery ahead for these families after this storm, and we Louisianians know all too well how tough that will be. Just like we stood with Texas, let's now stand strong with Florida.

I led a bipartisan letter to the Securities and Exchange Commission today demanding answers as to why Equifax executives were busy making millions while our private info was being stolen. The American people deserve answers, and I won't stop until we get them.

How can a person with a $10,000 government contract to "promote non-violence" advocate for the killing of our police officers? It's repulsive and a slap in the face to Baton Rouge families. I've asked the Dept. of Justice to investigate the BRAVE program and why he was given our money.

Tigers and Saints losing on the same weekend is tough. But hats off to these Louisiana teams who brought home the W for us this weekend: Nicholls State University Athletics, Louisiana Tech University, McNeese State University, Grambling State University, Northwestern State University.

If you have paid into Social Security, then that money belongs to YOU, not the government. I'm sponsoring the Social Security Fairness Act, which repeals the Windfall Elimination Provision and Government Pension Offset, so that our educators, firefighters, police officers, and others get back every penny they paid in to the system. Please like and share if you agree.

Middle class families are the engine of the American economy, and it's high time they're treated like it. I'm proposing doubling the standard deduction, which would put over $600 billion back into your pockets. I'm standing up for the middle class families and small businesses who desperately need some tax relief. Let me know if you agree.
It doesn't need to be pretty to be a win. I'll take it. #GeauxLSU
The Louisiana spirit knows no bounds. God bless the men and women working at these hospitals in northwest LA for serving these hurricane evacuees.

The professional left just don't seem to get it. It's not about whether someone has a right to protest. We all have that right. This is about doing what is appropriate. And I think most Americans believe that you should stand when the National Anthem is played to celebrate this country and the men and women who died for those "rights." I certainly do. Let me know what you think.
Middle class families and small businesses have been stuck paying the tab for far too long. Now, it's time we give them a tax code that believes in them.
I'm praying for the families, victims, and first responders of the Las Vegas shooting this morning. Please join me in doing the same.

This is why our brave men and women in law enforcement deserve our full support and respect. Because they wake up everyday to protect us and put our safety before their own. Thank you, Cpl. Michael Middlebrook, for your service and bravery. May God rest your soul. Please be in prayer for this family as they try to pick up the pieces.

What an amazing accomplishment for our education and scientific communities here in Louisiana! Heck of a job by these folks in Livingston Parish, LSU, and elsewhere. Louisiana is so proud of you and your work.

I'm proud to sponsor the Senate version of the Pain-Capable Unborn Child Protection Act because I believe that all life is created by God and deserves the utmost protection. Whether that life is 82 years old or 82 seconds old, the most important thing we can do as a society is value and protect the sanctity of life. Please stand with me, so that we can get this passed on the Senate side.

Other states are implementing Medicaid work requirements for able bodied adults, so why won't Louisiana? The answer from state government can't continue to be, "...more money, more money, more money." A simple Medicaid work requirement or small co-pay will save LA tax dollars just like it has for other states.

It's pretty simple: enforce America's immigration laws, period.   The last thing New Orleans can afford is to lose its federal funding to fight violent crime over this issue. Next week, I'll be speaking with Attorney General Sessions about ways to end New Orleans' status as a 'Sanctuary City' and enforce the rule of law.

It's put up or shut up time as far as I'm concerned. Millions of middle-class American families haven't seen their pay go up in over 10 years, and tax cuts for them are long overdue. It's win or go home for Republicans.
Obamacare is screwing 93% of Americans who are forced to pay higher premiums and subsidies for the 7%. We need fairness across the board for the families in the middle. We can do better than this.

Atty. General Sessions has agreed to meet with Mayor Landrieu and me to find an end to New Orleans' Sanctuary City policies. I can only hope that the Mayor takes me up on this offer, bc New Orleans can't afford to lose its federal funding to fight violent crime, which continues to be an epidemic there.

So honored to announce this grant for our Louisiana teachers and students. All that our teachers ask for are adequate resources and the authority to run their classrooms as they see fit. This grant will go a long way towards that.
I’m glad that the Mayor has agreed to meet and attempt to resolve this thing. Jeopardizing the federal funding that New Orleans receives to fight violent crime simply cannot be an option.
Alright now Saints. Time to rock n' roll. Let's GO!

I voted against rescinding the CFPB Arbitration Rule for two reasons: Equifax and veterans. Equifax lost the personal data - in many cases Social Security numbers - of just about every adult in LA. If my people want their day in court against Equifax, they should have it. Additionally, over 30 national veterans' organizations, including the American Legion and National Guard, asked me to vote against it. When men and women, who have risked their lives to protect Americans, speak, I listen. I know Wall Street is mad at me for my vote, but I have to do right by the people....always.  Please share if you agree, and let me know what you think about it.

Please remember that early voting started today and will run through Nov. 11th. With low turnout projected, we need all hands on deck for this one to keep a conservative like John Schroder as Treasurer. Tell your friends and family to go and vote early.

Supporting adoption is a pillar of what it means to be pro-life. And this credit goes a long way towards placing precious children with loving families.   Will you stand with me? Please share and like if you agree that the adoption tax credit should be saved.

Even our churches are now targets for evil acts like the one today. Please pray for First Baptist Church of Sutherland Springs, along with Pastor Pomeroy who lost his daughter in the shooting. Lord have mercy on this nation of ours.
It’s about putting dollars back into the wallets of Louisiana families. There’s no sugar coating this: middle class families need and deserve a tax cut. I won’t stop till we give them one.

After working with the Senate Finance Committee to save the Adoption Tax Credit, I’m happy to report that today’s bill saves the credit for our adoptive parents. Please share so we can get the word out.

Veterans mean everything to this nation. Sacrifice. Dedication. Selflessness. There simply aren’t enough words we could use to say thank you. I honored LA Vets Ira Schilling and Earl Messmer this week.   Please share this with the Veterans you know to honor their service on this Veterans' Day. #VeteransDay

Here is a column that I wrote about the huge responsibility that we as parents have in raising our children. I know that it’s already offended quite a few folks on the left, but I gotta call it like I see it. Let me know what you think.
Please remember that Election Day is this Saturday. Vote John Schroder to be our new Treasurer! He has my full support and endorsement.
Please remember to vote today! I’m standing with John Schroder for Treasurer, and you should too.
Congratulations to Louisiana’s newest state Treasurer, John Schroder. John is a strong conservative who will guard our tax dollars like they were his own. Please join me in congratulating him today!

This is America and everybody’s entitled to their own opinion. But I have a right to mine as well: This is ridiculous, and attacking the National Anthem, which honors our Veterans, only stands to divide us even more.

Happy Thanksgiving from my family to yours! We have so much to be thankful for here in America: our freedoms, our families, our faith, and the list keeps going. Enjoy this time with your loved ones today, and above all, give thanks!!
Please pray for Matthew’s family during this incredibly difficult time. He committed his life to defending ours and our freedoms, and we are forever indebted to him for his service.

When you release career criminals from prison and they’re back in jail days later, you have a problem. When a scandal plagued Dept of Corrections can’t even accurately account for all the prisoners it wants to release, you have a disaster.

I’m happy to cast my upcoming vote for Kyle Duncan to serve on the 5th Circuit Court of Appeals. Kyle is a strict Constitutionalist with conservative values who will make us proud. He was excellent in his hearing yesterday and proved to me that he is the man for the job.
Last night, the Senate passed tax cuts that will create over 12,000 new LA jobs and put nearly $2000 on average back into your pockets. That’s a win in my book.
Agree 100% with President Trump on this and grateful for his decision. Jerusalem is and will always be the capital of Israel and should be recognized as such.

This week, I sat down with President Trump to discuss how important our LA refinery jobs are to our families and for the economy. Our oil and gas families are just trying to get back on their feet after the downturn, and the President and I agreed that we’ve got to do everything in our power to get our energy sector moving again.
Please keep our former Governor, Kathleen Blanco, and her family in your prayers as she battles through this. She’s a strong lady, and I know she’s going to fight this thing every step of the way.

This legislation will put politicians back in the classroom to get a first hand glimpse of what our educators face every single day. A teacher’s value and their impact on our children can’t be overstated. Grateful that it passed the Senate.
Nobody in state government should be above the law! He should pay the back taxes on his freebies just like any of us would have to do.

I fought to ensure that the adoption tax credit was included in the tax reform bill, and I’m so happy to announce that the committee decided to preserve it. This is a huge win for the pro-life community and the countless families who have provided a forever home to children in need.

Religious liberty is a precious freedom that we must never take for granted. Please pray for these Christians and their families in Pakistan who only want to have that same freedom to worship without fear of persecution.

Under our plan, parents can use 529 savings accounts on private K-12 tuition as well as homeschooling costs. It’s about empowering parents. It’s about giving every child the opportunity to attend a great school regardless of their zip code.

The typical family in LA will see an extra $2,000 next year. That’s real money for real families. Dems said we needed higher tax rates to expand government programs. I completely disagree.  We also fought for an extra $100 million for LA in GOMESA funding from offshore drilling that will strengthen the coast.
This is exactly how it’s supposed to work. Instead of those dollars going to Washington, they go to American workers.

You know, it’s a sad day when the whole point of CHRISTmas - Jesus Christ - becomes offensive to others. Please join me in sharing the Good News of Christmas this season, even with those who may disagree. Share if you agree.
From my family to yours, have a Merry Christmas everybody!
Even Bernie Sanders agrees with the middle class tax cuts in our tax reform bill. I wish he and other Dems would have been willing to come alongside us from the beginning.
The people of Iran want freedom, not a corrupt and oppressive regime. President Trump is right to call out the Iranian government and stand with those demanding reforms.
May your New Year be filled with peace, joy and wonder.
